title: Joe Heap (author)
text:
Joe Heap (born 1986) is an English <a href="English%20literature">author</a> who resides in <a href="London">London</a>. His poetry has been published in several journals and he was a winner of the 2004 <a href="Foyles">Foyle Young Poet Award</a>. He was a guest author at the 2018 <a href="Edinburgh%20International%20Book%20Festival">Edinburgh International Book Festival</a>. 
Life and works.
Heap was born in London and grew up in <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a>, West <a href="Yorkshire">Yorkshire</a>. He later moved to <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a> where he completed a Masters in Creative Writing at the <a href="University%20of%20Glasgow">University of Glasgow</a>. Heap’s first book, The Rules of Seeing (HarperCollins, 2018), was shortlisted for the <a href="Books%20Are%20My%20Bag%20Readers%27%20Awards">Books Are My Bag</a> Breakthrough Author award and won the <a href="Romantic%20Novelists%27%20Association%20Awards">RNA</a>’s Debut Romantic Novel award in 2018. His second novel was When The Music Stops (HarperCollins, 2020).
